title: Installation issue: libssh (linking against system instead of spack krb5 libraries)
body:
I ran into the following issues
libssh@0.8.5%gcc@8.4.0 build_type=RelWithDebInfo
resulting in errors like:
> /usr/lib64/libk5crypto.so: undefined reference to `EVP_KDF_derive@OPENSSL_1_1_1b'
> /usr/lib64/libk5crypto.so: undefined reference to `EVP_KDF_ctrl@OPENSSL_1_1_1b'
> /usr/lib64/libk5crypto.so: undefined reference to `EVP_KDF_CTX_new_id@OPENSSL_1_1_1b'
> /usr/lib64/libk5crypto.so: undefined reference to `EVP_KDF_CTX_free@OPENSSL_1_1_1b
(full build log attached further down)

This occurred on a zen2 system running RHEL8.2, having previously successfully built on ivybridge and plain x86_64 systems.  However, the aforementioned Intel builds were done prior to some OS patches, and an attempt to spack install --overwrite on the ivybridge system resulted in the same error.

It appears that libssh 
1. does not have a krb5 dependency listed in spack
1. will detect and use a system krb5 library if present if WITH_GSSAPI is set (I am not sure if this is set by default or only set if a krb5 library is found)

This means that if system krb5 libraries are found, they will be linked against.

I propose adding a boolean variant gssapi, and if unset force WITH_GSSAPI off so no external krb5 library will be linked against, and if set make spack's krb5 a dependency.

### Steps to reproduce the issue
spack install libssh
on a system with system kerberos libraries
and the resulting libraries appear to be linked against system krb5 libraries.

### Information on your system
spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.14.2
* **Python:** 3.6.8
* **Platform:** linux-rhel8-ivybridge

### Additional information
Full environment and build output attached:
[spack-build-env.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/5064262/spack-build-env.txt)
[spack-build-out.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/5064263/spack-build-out.txt)

No maintainers found for libssh
